titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

bioghist.p: The Inter-Presbyterian Ministers Association of Los Angeles was established in 1911. The object of the Association was "the closer fellowship, the intellectual stimulus, and the spiritual quickening of its members, together with the promotion of that portion of the Redeemer's Kingdom with which its members are especially identified." The association dissolved in 1915.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains minutes of the Inter-Presbyterian Ministers' Association, 1911-1915, bound with minutes of the Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Los Angeles, 1915-1917. Minutes of the Inter-Presbyterian Ministers' Association document the group's monthly meetings, and include constitution and by-laws, reports of committees, addresses read, and other routine business. The volume also includes some accounting information for the Inter-Presbyterian Ministers' Association. Minutes of the Presbyterian Ministers Association of Los Angeles include reports of committees, addresses read, and other routine business.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
